progression.increment: Increase reps until you hit 12, then add weight and drop to 8 reps
progression.deload: Deload 20% every 5-6 weeks or when fatigue accumulates
tips: Train 1-2 reps from failure on most sets
Focus on mind-muscle connection and tempo (2-4 sec negatives)
Increase volume gradually (add 1 set per week)
Track your workouts to ensure progressive overload
Consider periodization (vary rep ranges and intensity)
May need advanced techniques (drop sets, rest-pause) for continued progress

exercise.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercise.description: The king of upper body pressing movements. Lie flat on bench, grip bar slightly wider than shoulder width. Lower bar to mid-chest with elbows at 45° angle. Press back up explosively while maintaining tension. This compound movement primarily targets the mid chest while engaging triceps and front delts as secondary movers.

exercise.name: Incline Barbell Press
exercise.description: Premier movement for upper chest development. Set bench to 30-45° angle. Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders, lower to upper chest. Press up in straight line. The incline angle shifts emphasis to clavicular head of pectoralis major while increasing front delt involvement.

exercise.name: Cable Flyes
exercise.description: Pure chest isolation with constant tension. Stand between cable stations, arms extended with slight bend. Bring handles together in hugging motion while maintaining elbow angle. Focus on squeezing chest at peak contraction. Cables provide resistance throughout entire range unlike dumbbells.

exercise.name: Pull-Ups
exercise.description: The king of back exercises. Hang from bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulders. Pull yourself up until chin clears bar, focusing on bringing elbows down and back. Lower with control. Builds incredible lat width and overall back thickness while heavily engaging biceps.

exercise.name: Barbell Rows
exercise.description: Premier movement for back thickness. Hinge at hips with slight knee bend, torso at 45°. Pull bar to lower chest/upper abs, keeping elbows close to body. Focus on driving elbows back. Builds massive mid-back thickness, lats, and rear delts while engaging biceps heavily.

exercise.name: Face Pulls
exercise.description: Essential for rear delt and upper back development. Set rope attachment at face height. Pull toward face while flaring elbows high and wide. Externally rotate shoulders at peak contraction. Critical for shoulder health, posture, and balanced upper body development.

exercise.name: Barbell Back Squats
exercise.description: The king of all exercises. Bar on upper back, feet shoulder-width. Descend until thighs parallel or below. Drive through heels to stand. Builds massive quads, glutes, and overall lower body mass. Strengthens entire posterior chain and core.
